messages.title: Aims that work for all of us
messages.content: Ensuring everyone has access to good quality, stable employment. Josh wants to support local businesses, the NHS, and create child-friendly towns.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Putting respect & dignity back into the work place
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Josh is fighting for secure employment, a living wage for all, and is against zero-hour contracts.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A new look country pub to community outlet transport
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Advocating for reliable public transport and re-regulating bus services to ensure they meet the needs of Calder Valley.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Fragile. Look after the Earth carefully!
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Commitment to taking action on climate change and supporting a Green Industrial Revolution.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Strategic voting considerations or historical voting patterns are not explicitly mentioned.

issues.brexitEurope: Brexit is not explicitly mentioned in the provided content.
issues.immigration: Immigration is not explicitly mentioned in the provided content.
issues.socialWelfare: Secure employment and a living wage.

housing.content: Housing is not explicitly mentioned in the provided content.

leaflet.personalStatement: Josh's statement emphasises his commitment to fighting for every job, supporting local businesses, the NHS, and ensuring child-friendly towns.

politicalExperience.achievements: Working on the Children & Young People Scrutiny Panel to challenge and improve services.

endorsements.endorsement: Praises Josh as a dedicated and hardworking local councillor.

quotes.text: We need a living wage for all.

images.caption: Photos of Josh Fenton-Glynn interacting with constituents, supporting local businesses, and in various community settings.
